page.title: 03A LIFETIME IN UTTOXETER(con)
page.content: Once the headmaster gave four boys the cane as they did not raise their caps to him in town.About 1922 she used to go down the 'rec'. There were a few swings and a fresh water swimming pool. If you stood on a swing you got told off. To get to the Catholic high school Stoke she caught a train.If she was late it waited.I would never do that now.There was no gym at school. To exercise they marched around saying time tables. She remembers rationing in the 2nd World War for sugar,bacon,flour,meat,fruit,clothes and eggs. There was no coffee and only 3o spoons of sugar a week for her family.Now she is a teacher. In an air raid children took their books to a shelter and got on .One plane dropped a bomb through a house but it did not go off.After the war there was a party in the cattle market.We liked her talk.
